N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 9500.2 - Definitions

State Regulations

As used in this Part, the following terms shall have the
following meanings, unless the context shall indicate another or different
meaning or intent: (a) Trust shall mean
the Natural Heritage Trust, a public benefit corporation established by chapter
653 of the Laws of 1968 and further described in article 55 of the Arts and

Cultural Affairs Law. (b) Board
shall mean the board of the Natural Heritage Trust as provided for in section
55.05
of the Arts and Cultural Affairs

Law. (c) Contract shall mean an
enforceable agreement entered into between the trust and a
contractor. (d) Contractor shall
mean any person, partnership, private corporation, or association: (1)
selling materials, equipment or supplies
or leasing property or equipment to the trust; (2)
constructing, reconstructing, rehabilitating or repairing buildings, highways or other improvements for or on
behalf of the trust; or
(3)
rendering or providing services to the trust pursuant to a contract. (e) Designated payment office shall
mean the office designated by the trust to which a proper invoice is to be
submitted by a contractor. (1)

For Artpark
programs the designated payment office shall be: Natural Heritage Trust

Artpark
P. O. Box 371

Lewiston, NY 14092
(2)

Unless otherwise specified, for all other
purposes the designated payment office shall be: Natural Heritage Trust

Attention: Development Officer

Agency Bldg. 1, 20th Floor

Empire State Plaza

Albany, NY 12238
(f) Prompt payment shall mean payment of a
debt due and owing by the trust before interest accrues thereon pursuant to
this Part. (g) Proper invoice shall
mean a written request for a contract payment that is submitted by a contractor
setting forth the description, price and quantity of goods, property, or
services delivered or rendered, in such form and supported by such other
substantiating documentation as the trust may reasonably require. (h) Receipt of an invoice shall mean the
later of: (1)
the date on which a proper
invoice is actually received in the designated payment office; or
(2)
the date on which the trust receives the
purchased goods, property or services covered by the proper invoice. (i) Set-off shall mean the
reduction by the trust of a payment due to a contractor by an amount equal to
the amount of an unpaid legally enforceable debt owed by the contractor to the
trust. Notes
